normalised: What is the deal with the gym obsession in Indian cities lately? Is it just a trend or is there something more to it?

unnormalised: **What's the deal with the gym obsession in Indian cities lately? Is it just a trend or is there something more to it?**
normalised: Hey everyone! So, I have been noticing something major in cities like Mumbai, Bangalore, and Delhi – gyms popping up everywhere! It seems like everyone, from college students to even my uncle Doctor Sharma, is suddenly hitting the iron.

unnormalised: Hey everyone! So, I've been noticing something major in cities like Mumbai, Bangalore, and Delhi – gyms popping up everywhere! It seems like everyone, from college students to even my uncle Dr. Sharma, is suddenly hitting the iron.
normalised: Is it just a fad fueled by Bollywood body transformations and those influencer reels showing ripped physiques? Maybe. But I think there is more to it than just wanting to look like Hrithik Roshan (no shade to Hrithik, of course!).

unnormalised: Is it just a fad fueled by Bollywood body transformations and those influencer reels showing ripped physiques? Maybe. But I think there's more to it than just wanting to look like Hrithik Roshan (no shade to Hrithik, of course!).
normalised: For many, especially young professionals, it is a way to de-stress after a long day battling traffic and work deadlines. Those endorphins after a good workout are seriously a lifesaver. Plus, it has become a social thing, right? You meet people, build community, and share tips – kind of like hanging out at a chai tapri, but with dumbbells.

normalised: I have also seen a definite shift in awareness about health. People are investing in their well-being, whether it is joining a fancy gym with all the latest equipment (think five thousand square feet of pure fitness) or just doing yoga in their apartment.

unnormalised: I’ve also seen a definite shift in awareness about health. People are investing in their well-being, whether it's joining a fancy gym with all the latest equipment (think 5000 sq ft of pure fitness) or just doing yoga in their apartment.
normalised: Of course, there is the pressure to look a certain way thanks to social media. But I think, for many, it is about feeling good, both physically and mentally. Are the subscription prices sometimes crazy (rupees ten thousand plus per month at some places!), and the pressure intense? Yes. But the benefits, from increased stamina to improved mental health, are definitely real. And that is a trend I hope sticks around longer than the latest protein shake flavor. What are your thoughts? Let me know in the comments! I usually cycle ten kilometer to get to my gym.
